Adult male.description: Adult male Summer Tanagers are entirely red, without the black wings and tail of adult male Scarlet Tanagers.

Female.description: Female Summer Tanagers are yellow overall and do not have darker wings like female/nonbreeding male Scarlet Tanagers.

Adult male.description: Adult male Western Tanagers have yellow underparts while Scarlet Tanagers have red underparts. Ranges rarely overlap: Western Tanagers breed in western North America and Scarlet Tanagers breed in eastern North America.

Female.description: Female Western Tanagers have 2 wingbars whereas female/nonbreeding male Scarlet Tanagers have unmarked dark wings. Ranges rarely overlap: Western Tanagers breed in western North America and Scarlet Tanagers breed in eastern North America.

Male.description: Northern Cardinals do not have the black wings or the black tail seen on breeding male Scarlet Tanagers.
